allReviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great product but really bad generic charger 2.1A 10W
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2024
allReviews.body: The Samsung S21 Ultra has exceeded my expectations in almost every aspect. From its stunning display to its powerhouse performance, this flagship smartphone truly stands out in the crowded market. Let me delve into the details of what makes this device a must-have, while also shedding light on an area that could use some improvement.First and foremost, let's talk about the display. The S21 Ultra boasts a breathtaking Dynamic AMOLED 2X screen with a 120Hz refresh rate, delivering unparalleled clarity and vibrancy. Whether I'm streaming my favorite movies or gaming with friends, every visual detail pops with stunning realism. It's like having a cinema in the palm of my hand.Performance-wise, the S21 Ultra is an absolute beast. Powered by the latest Snapdragon processor (or Exynos depending on the region), coupled with generous RAM, this smartphone effortlessly handles multitasking, gaming, and productivity tasks with lightning-fast speed. Apps launch instantly, and I can seamlessly switch between tasks without any lag or stutter.One of the standout features of the S21 Ultra is its camera system. With a quad-camera setup including a 108MP main sensor, 10x optical zoom, and 100x Space Zoom, this phone lets me capture moments with astonishing clarity and detail. Whether it's a scenic landscape or a close-up shot, the photos turn out sharp and vibrant, even in low light conditions.The sleek design of the S21 Ultra is another aspect that I absolutely adore. From its premium build quality to its ergonomic feel in hand, Samsung has nailed the aesthetics of this device. It's a perfect blend of style and functionality, making it a pleasure to use and show off.However, no device is without its flaws, and in the case of the S21 Ultra, it's the included charger. While the smartphone itself supports fast charging up to 25W, the included 2.1A 10W ONLY charger feels somewhat underwhelming. In today's fast-paced world, where every minute counts, having a more powerful charger would significantly enhance the user experience, allowing for quicker top-ups on the go.

    As Advertised
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2025
allReviews.body: Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed) is in Excellent Condition as advertised.  I especially like the 10X optical zoom lens. The camera’s Night Mode setting is capable of photographing night sky constellations.  The camera is capable of saving photos in RAW format by downloading Samsung's RAW App.  Image resolution of the main 1X 108MP camera lens is more grainy than expected.  I'm not sure if it is just a defective main lens in this camera or as a result of software processes such as pixel binning?  The Gorilla Glass screen should prevent display damages.  I think the curved glass edges makes tempered glass screen protectors difficult to stay on and I'm having issues finding a tempered glass that doesn't greatly reduce the sensitivity for this S21 Ultra's fingerprint scanner.  Overall, an impressively designed smartphone by Samsung.

allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2024
allReviews.body: So as of now I am writing this review after only 1 full day of owning the phone, and so far it seems to be nearly perfect. Now I say nearly because it definitely had one or two things here or there that gave me iffy feelings at first. One example of this is that there were very mild scratches on the side of the camera bump, and while normally that would bother me a lot more, I didn't mind it too much since it wasn't effecting the phones performance, and I put a case over it anyway so I don't see them now. I inserted the sim card from my old phone and it all seems to work just fine with no issues that I am able to see as of this moment, though I hear stories of phones sometimes giving up on the sim card after about a month, so I will have to wait and see on that front. And finally I should say that I have always been incredibly skeptical of buying used phones in general, let alone online, but given the price of the phone and the fairly high standards I set for it I am really rather impressed. If anything I just mentioned happens to change sometime in the near future I will definitely come back and change my review accordingly but until then I will 100% recommend this phone for the price

I just wasn't as impressed as I was hoping I would be. The seller did a great job packaging the phone and the delivery was prompt. I would just suggest getting a new one, or at least one in "like new" condition if you're considering purchasing one.

allReviews.body: I've had this phone for 2 days now. The phone looks great and works as expected. Unfortunately,  I'm not impressed with the battery life. The only complaint I have us I wish they would of caught the fact of the battery issue plus the fact it took longer to receive from Amazon than at first stated. I will order another one from Amazon and take a chance since in the past 4 phones I've ordered I never had an issue.

    Not technically unlocked
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
allReviews.body: Well, after 2 days of waiting to replace a broken pixel 6a during the start of the school year, the day finally arrived when I got it in the mail. I went for the excellent option, and I'd say it was worth the extra. No major scratches, a little dirty but that's okay. However, when I went to turn in this beautiful powerful behemoth, I saw the dreaded At&T logo. After hours of fiddling with the sim card trying to get it to accept my at&t unlocking code, I finally got it to work (without putting in my code?). I managed to disable most of the at&t bloatware but it's still there alright and will probably haunt me. But it connected to Metro by T-Mobile just fine after a online transfer of IMEIs. It works perfectly, the fastest phone Ive ever owned and battery seems to be pretty darn good considering the age of the phone. The 100x zoom is crazy but the camera will need fiddling to get those perfect shots to compete with the pixel. Good phone, not so great experience setting up the phone. Plus is a fast charger was included.

2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Loved It Until...
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
allReviews.body: So I absolutely loved this phone for the first 8 months I owned it. I took the time to find the best case for the optional spen (supcase UB Pro), and having the s pen with this phone was an absolute game changer for my organization and photo editing skills...so much functionality. Loved it, especially the handwritten notes you can jot down without having to even turn the phone on.So it was all going great, until it slipped out of my hand and fell 4 inches into a clean toilet bowl. I fished it out right away and dried it off, but I knew the phone comes with an IP68 rating and I had a spigen Neoflex screen protector and the UB Pro case, so I figured my phone would be more than fine. With the protection rating of the bare phone PLUS all the extra protection I carried it in, in my head I was more than fine....Guess again. Phone shorted out within 20 minutes and I got the green screen of death at startup. Completely fried. So that really socks. What the hell is the point of IP68 if a 4" drop-slide into some water bricks the phone? I have no idea but hopefully my testimony will be a warning to some: treat this phone as if any water will absolutely destroy it, because it just might. I'm still trying to figure out how to sign into my Samsung account on another device without having this one available, because of Samsungs 2FA they ONLY want to send a code to my s21U, which is bricked. So far Samsung customer service has been completely inept

criticalReviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Loved It Until...
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
criticalReviews.body: So I absolutely loved this phone for the first 8 months I owned it. I took the time to find the best case for the optional spen (supcase UB Pro), and having the s pen with this phone was an absolute game changer for my organization and photo editing skills...so much functionality. Loved it, especially the handwritten notes you can jot down without having to even turn the phone on.So it was all going great, until it slipped out of my hand and fell 4 inches into a clean toilet bowl. I fished it out right away and dried it off, but I knew the phone comes with an IP68 rating and I had a spigen Neoflex screen protector and the UB Pro case, so I figured my phone would be more than fine. With the protection rating of the bare phone PLUS all the extra protection I carried it in, in my head I was more than fine....Guess again. Phone shorted out within 20 minutes and I got the green screen of death at startup. Completely fried. So that really socks. What the hell is the point of IP68 if a 4" drop-slide into some water bricks the phone? I have no idea but hopefully my testimony will be a warning to some: treat this phone as if any water will absolutely destroy it, because it just might. I'm still trying to figure out how to sign into my Samsung account on another device without having this one available, because of Samsungs 2FA they ONLY want to send a code to my s21U, which is bricked. So far Samsung customer service has been completely inept

I performed these steps and experienced temporary relief. After this issue continued, I contacted the Seller and was told to perform the same steps as above, as well as check for software updates and do a total reset of the phone. Again I performed these steps and only received temporary relief. When I contacted the seller again I was told my order was outside of their "30 days return window and 90 day warranty. Thus return option is not available." They recommended for service, I should contact Samsung or take the phone to local repair professional such as UBREAKIFIX or DIY IFIXIT.Since this is a refurbished phone and the issue is clearly a defect with the phone and not due to my negligence, I believe a satisfactory resolve should be the Seller offering to replace this device with another.

criticalReviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I guess when it comes to refurbished it IS hit or miss...
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2022
criticalReviews.body: I took my time using this phone in order to give a thorough review. Since this phone is my daily driver, I really can't supply pictures of it but when it comes to the appearance, the phone came pristine. Sides and back glass came pristine, front glass have almost invisible scratches so nothing of note in this front.Performance wise, though, this phone seems to have a really hard time keeping stable mobile signal indoors. I tested this phone on plenty of places and compared to other people's phones around me, and thus, I discarded carrier issues.Looking at forums, there are lots of reports of signal issues. Some people say it happened after the Android 12 update; others say their phones would always have signal issues. In both cases, Samsung had solved the issue by replacing customers' units. Because I'm currently abroad, it's impossible to have the phone RMA'd by amazon. Not saying they wouldn't receive my phone- in other cases their customer service has been top notch, so I assume Amazon would assist me on this.TL;DR: be cautious about refurbished units of this model in particular.UPDATE: Two stars because a smartphone that can't be used as a phone most of the time isn't very smart.

It worked great for the first 3 months until Samsung did their 6.0 UI undate, then my touch screen would no longer respond. Come to find out not only did the company who sold me the phone use aftermarket products, they used the cheapest ones they could find. And, they hot glued the back on! After contacting the seller since it was only two weeks out of warranty, they said sure, just do a factory reset to clear all your info off the phone and send it back and we'll send you another one. Sounds great, unless you can't get into your phone to do ANYTHING!! So I ended up getting the phone fixed myself, almost 300 dollars later, the phone works like new. Reached out to the seller to see about getting a credit or partial refund and they offered me a $20.00 refund. LOL! I said too little. So just know that if you buy from this company, they use the cheapest aftermarket parks that they can.

criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
criticalReviews.body: The phone has never connected to a 5G network despite it being a 5G phone on a 5G network.  As a result, streaming music and videos is poor and buffers like old school cellphones.  And yes, I have tried every connection setting and all are setup to allow/connect with 5g.  Sometimes it won't connect to any network at all for 30 minutes at a time and then reconnect all of a sudden.  This seems to happen at the most inopportune times when navigating using Google maps and I have to pull over.It won't fast charge at all, even though it says it is fast charging. It will take 7+hrs for a full charge.  You better hope you don't forget to charge it overnight, every single night.  Camera is great, screen quality is great. It would be a good phone if it worked like it is supposed to.  It's my fault for missing the return window but returning anything is a major hassle and don't want to/can't go a day without a phone so I just deal with it now. That said, this is so frustrating and I'm about to just throw it in the trash and get something else.  I would not recommend purchasing a refurb version of this. If you do, be ready to deal with return hassles.

However, when I asked about the charger Amazon started a return process and wouldn't cancel it. It's been way too frustrating for what should be easy. If the phone doesn't charge like it after I try again, then I will have to return it and just try to make up for what was going to be the big part of my daughter's Christmas. Disappointed in Amazon.

criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
criticalReviews.body: Purchased phone off Amazon in May 24'. Phone touch-screen went inoperative June 24' with OTA update to 6.1 firmware. It's a complete brick now, because the touch screen does not work!!!None of my local phone repair places can fix it for me, so it's useless. Spent all that money for whats now a paperweight (and I'm past the return window to Amazon by a week naturally).  Thankfully I saved my old beater phone so I have a functioning phone (needed for work! and everything else).No help from Samsung as it was a re-furbed phone with likely an aftermarket replacement screen. If you do buy one of these, do not let it do the OTA update to 6.1!!! If you are savvy with a laptop and re-flashing firmware to an older version, you may be able to un-brick the phone if this happens to you (but you will still lose all data on the phone unless you have been backing it up).Don't know what I will do now, certainly not going to buy another Samsung phone product ever again.

productDetails.productTitle: Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
featureBullets: This phone is unlocked and compatible with any carrier of choice on GSM and CDMA networks (e.g. AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, Verizon, Cricket, Tracfone, Mint Mobile, etc.).
Please check with your carrier to verify compatibility.
When you receive the phone, insert a SIM card from a compatible carrier. Then, turn it on, connect to Wi-Fi, and follow the on screen prompts to activate service.
The device does not come with headphones or a SIM card. It does include a charger and charging cable that may be generic.
Comes packaged in an aftermarket box.
